title: Sr Business Analyst-Airlines Experience
description:
Sr Business Analyst -Airline Experience

About Us

Zapcom is a global Product Engineering and Technology Services company, specializing in bespoke, customer-centric solutions across industries like BFSI, e-commerce, retail, travel, transportation, and hospitality. Headquartered in the US, with a presence in India, Europe, Canada, and MENA, we excel in transforming ideas into tangible outcomes using AI, ML, Cloud solutions, and full-stack development.

At Zapcom, we value accountability, ownership, and equality, empowering you to excel. We listen to your aspirations and provide the support needed to achieve them. Our diverse, collaborative culture ensures every voice is heard, driving innovation and business value. With global opportunities and expansion plans, now is the perfect time to join our team. Work on impactful projects that shape the future. Apply today and be part of something extraordinary.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Strong business acumen with the ability to elicit business requirements from a variety of stakeholders and represent the voice of the business and the customer


  • Collaborates primarily with stake holders, scrum teams and other stakeholders to identify and close product gaps.


  • Experience writing requirements in the form of user stories


  • Experience refining and clarifying requirements with both business and IT stakeholders by creating various artifacts such as process maps, wire frames, mockups, etc.


  • Excellent communication skills; comfortable leading sessions and presenting findings to all levels of the organization


  • Ability to build trusted partnerships with cross-functional stakeholders at all levels of the organization


  • Adequate technical acumen to communicate effectively with engineers and understand technical tradeoffs


  • Lead grooming and clarification sessions to provide engineering, QA, and UAT teams detailed requirements to develop and test against


  • Partner with Product Managers to execute on the product roadmap by working with cross-functional teams to capture business requirements and create supporting artifacts


  • Partner with various stakeholders to extract defects and opportunities to be converted into the product backlog


  • Partner with user experience to translate UI design and research into actionable development ready user stories


  • Partner with User Acceptance Testers to ensure the delivered product meets the business objectives and launch criteria


  • Successfully communicate and work with brand presidents, officers, external contacts, and internal departments to perform responsibilities.


  • Use and continue “paperless” document management systems.


  • Maintain confidentiality of personal information.


  • Interface with others in a professional manner and be a trusted go to person.


  • Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Required Attributes:

  • Knowledge of airline industry.


  • Ability to manage multiple responsibilities at a given time while remaining organized, paying strict attention to detail, and meeting critical deadlines within a high volume, fast-paced environment


  • Provide business analyst support for large transformational projects through activities such as requirements workshops, process mapping exercises, and gap analysis, training


  • Be proactive and utilize critical thinking to make the right decisions for our customers and business


  • Self-starter. Ability to work autonomously with little support.


  • Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines.


Education & Experience:

Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Systems Engineering or relevant field of study preferred

Experience:

  • 8+ years of business analyst experience, preferably in Omnichannel or eCommerce/Point of sale applications. 2+ years should be in the relevant airline industry as Product Owner or Business Analyst is mandatory.


  • Experience with MS Visio or similar workflow process tools.


  • Experience with JIRA or similar tools preferred.


  • Experience working in agile delivery models preferred.


  • Experience working with product management teams preferred.
company_description: Zapcom empowers businesses with digital transformation through cutting-edge software solutions. As a global leader in product engineering and services, we specialize in AI-driven innovation, utilizing

title: Business Analyst
description:
Title: Business Analyst

Location: Houston, Texas

Type: Contract

Hourly Rate: $60.00 - $70.00 Per hour

Summary:

The Business Analyst will have rail operations experience, a strong understanding of refineries, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, be self-driven, takes ownership, and works well in a team environment.

Duties:

  • Monitor SAP interfaces with Rail applications; troubleshooting, analyzing, improving, and timely resolving issues
  • Be an in-house expert for Truck & Rail application systems; sharing knowledge with others
  • Utilize analytics tools and reports to facilitate improved decision making
  • Lead/assist with special or cross-functional projects that aide in business improvement opportunities, as needed
  • Own business process development, improvement, optimization, and sustainability for assigned Commercial functions and stakeholders

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience working in the oil and gas logistics or transportation industry with specific rail knowledge
  • 3+ years of SAP S4 experience
  • Excellent analytical & problem-solving skills to support business focused analysis and decisions
  • High degree of collaborative skills, personal drive, and dedication to achieving team goals and general interest objectives
  • Proficient in Microsoft applications
  • Strong interpersonal skills characterized by effective communication, teamwork, influence, as well as the ability to quickly develop trust, establish strong relationships and drive results
  • Sound business acumen with knowledge of key value drivers

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience with SAP S4 and R3 with specific focus on Vendor Billing Documents, nominations, R3 Shipment Cost Documents, and ticketing
  • 3+ years of SAP idoc experience

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, or related discipline with strong analytical emphasis

title: QA Engineer
description:
Your opportunity


At Schwab, you’re empowered to make an impact on your career. Here, innovative thought meets creative problem solving, helping us “challenge the status quo” and transform the finance industry together.

We Believe in the importance of in-office collaboration and fully intend for the selected candidate for this role to work on site in the specified location(s).

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full time basis without employer sponsorship.


In Schwab Cybersecurity Services (SCS), Office of CISO, we provide platforms, services, and security operations capabilities which enable the firm to produce successful client and shareholder outcomes securely and safely. Securing our IT assets, data, and access to applications is the core of who we are and what we do. We ensure only the appropriate entities have access to IT resources and that we adhere to best practices and standards to ensure a safe and compliant environment.

We are seeking an experienced Test Engineer to ensure the client experience is of highest quality. In this role, you will challenge yourself as an organized and experienced engineer who has an eye for quality, to collaborate closely with business partners to understand requirements and use various automation toolsets to contribute to automated testing suites for the applications you support.

What you have


Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or a related field
  • 8+ years of hands-on QA engineering and testing experience with progressive testing responsibilities including but not limited to designing and executing API, UI, Scheduled Jobs, and DB test scenarios/cases
  • 6+ years of experience in Front End Technologies/Concepts: JSP / Java, Angular and/or AngularJS, JSON/XML, Sync/Async services
  • 6+ years of experience in Back End Technologies/Concepts: Advanced technical competency in an OOP language Java, J2EE and RESTful API design, Micro-Services and Event-drive driven architecture and frameworks
  • 6+ years of experience in developing test automation scripts, particularly web-enabled applications
  • 3-5 years of experience with Agile methodologies and collaboration tools
  • 2-4 years of experience with JIRA to support test case execution or other case management tools
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Advanced expertise in quality assurance testing activities for the designated business area to develop effective testing practices to confirm integrity and reliability of business operations
  • Experience supporting Cyber Security tools/applications, including but not limited to Identity and Access Management (IAM) technologies such as SailPoint Identity IQ (IIQ), PING ID, and/or HYPR or related applications in Cyber Security
  • Able to effectively communicate essential information across multiple departments and groups including technical and non-technical audiences
  • Experience and understanding of overall software development processes including business analysis, development, testing, maintenance, and improvement of software
  • Strong understanding of techniques such as Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and Testing Framework


In addition to the salary range, this role is also eligible for bonus or incentive opportunities.


What’s in it for you

At Schwab, you’re empowered to shape your future. We champion your growth through meaningful work, continuous learning, and a culture of trust and collaboration—so you can build the skills to make a lasting impact. Our Hybrid Work and Flexibility approach balances our ongoing commitment to workplace flexibility, serving our clients, and our strong belief in the value of being together in person on a regular basis.

We offer a competitive benefits package that takes care of the whole you – both today and in the future:

  • 401(k) with company match and Employee stock purchase plan
  • Paid time for vacation, volunteering, and 28-day sabbatical after every 5 years of service for eligible positions
  • Paid parental leave and family building benefits
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
company_description: Schwab was built around a simple idea: put the client first. We work hard to make our clients’ goals the focus of everything we do by offering a better, more modern way to build and manage wealth.

title: Customer Success Specialist
description:
About Kuona

Kuona is an AI-driven SaaS platform that helps CPG brands and retailers improve pricing, promotions, demand forecasting, and inventory management. Using advanced machine learning models, Kuona delivers real-time insights that help companies increase revenue and operate more efficiently.
We are growing quickly and are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Entry-Level Customer Success Associate to join our team.

Job Summary

As an Entry-Level Customer Success Associate, you will support our customers as they adopt and use the Kuona platform. You will assist in onboarding new clients, answering questions, analyzing basic data, and helping customers understand how to get the most value from our AI solutions.
This role is ideal for someone who is curious, proactive, and excited to learn about retail, analytics, and AI technologies.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support the onboarding of new customers by helping them set up and navigate the Kuona platform.
  • Provide responsive and friendly assistance via email, chat, and video calls.
  • Gather customer requirements and help translate them into actionable steps for internal teams.
  • Assist in preparing product demos, training materials, and documentation.
  • Monitor customer usage and identify opportunities to improve engagement.
  • Work with the Customer Success and Data Science teams to troubleshoot issues and deliver solutions.
  • Collect customer feedback and share insights to help improve the product.
  • Ensure a positive customer experience by maintaining strong communication and follow-through.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Data Analytics, Marketing, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to learn new software tools quickly and explain them clearly to others.
  • Basic understanding of data, spreadsheets, and business analytics (Excel/Google Sheets).
  • A proactive, problem-solving mindset and strong attention to detail.
  • Interest in AI, retail, pricing, or consumer goods is a plus.
  • Previous internship or part-time experience in customer support, business analysis, or client-facing roles is a plus, but not required.

What We Offer

  • Full remote flexibility.
  • Training, mentorship, and growth opportunities within a fast-scaling AI company.
  • Exposure to real-world projects with global CPG and retail clients.
  • A collaborative, diverse, and supportive team environment.

Pay: $49,402.15 - $59,495.06 per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Volunteer time off

Work Location: In person

title: Business Systems Analyst Consultant - SQL/Data Mapping/Oracle
description:
Job Profile

Position Overview
At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. We work together each day to foster an inclusive workplace culture where all of our employees feel respected, valued and have an opportunity to contribute to the company’s success. As a Software Engineer Sr. within PNC’s Technology organization, you will be based in Pittsburgh, PA; Cleveland, OH; Dallas, TX ; Jacksonville, FL; Miamisburg, OH. or Phoenix, AZ. This position is primarily based in a location within PNC’s footprint.

**This position will require weekly onsite time in one of the locations listed.**

Key Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with Product and Compliance teams to define requirements for core banking features
  • Ensure all requirements explicitly address regulatory constraints
  • Identify and document non-functional requirements
Technical Story Writing & Data Mapping

  • Write detailed User Stories with acceptance criteria that account for financial edge cases
  • Perform detailed Data Mapping between modern digital channels (Web/Mobile) and legacy Core Banking Systems
System Analysis & Validation

  • Use SQL to query MySQL/Oracle databases to validate business logic and investigate production data discrepancies.
  • Analyze API specs to define integration contracts (Request/Response models).
  • Create sequence diagrams to visualize the flow of funds and data across microservices.
PNC will not provide sponsorship for employment visas or participate in STEM OPT for this position.

Job Description
Provides solutions for IT and business management on applying technology to business opportunities, planning and implementation of cross-functional applications.
Participates in identifying, evaluating, and configuring systems that are cost effective and meet business requirements .
Monitors client experiences and feedback on the use of business applications; Enhanced system productivity, as needed .
Provides senior level consulting services to internal business groups on process improvement projects designed to improve their business results .
Analyzes, defines and documents clients requirements, and revises existing systems logic challenges, as necessary .

PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:
Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.

Qualifications

Successful candidates must demonstrate appropriate knowledge, skills, and abilities for a role. Listed below are skills, competencies, work experience, education, and required certifications/licensures needed to be successful in this position.

Preferred Skills Application Development, Business Management, Customer Solutions, Design, Group Problem Solving, Process Improvements, Release Management, Software Solutions, User Experience (UX) Design

Competencies Business Assessment, Business Process Modeling, IT Environment, IT Project Management, Requirements Analysis, Technical Writing/Documentation, Workflow Analysis

Work Experience Roles at this level typically require a university / college degree, with 3+ years of relevant / direct industry experience. Certifications are often desired. In lieu of a degree, a comparable combination of education, job specific certification(s), and experience (including military service) may be considered.

Education Bachelors

Certifications No Required Certification(s)

Licenses CBAP (Certified Business Analysis Professional) certification preferred.

Pay Transparency
Base Salary: $55,000.00 – $120,750.00

Salaries may vary based on geographic location, market data and on individual skills, experience, and education. This role is incentive eligible with the payment based upon company, business and/or individual performance.

Application Window
Generally, this opening is expected to be posted for two business days from 11/28/2025, although it may be longer with business discretion.

Benefits
PNC offers a comprehensive range of benefits to help meet your needs now and in the future. Depending on your eligibility, options for full-time employees include: medical/prescription drug coverage (with a Health Savings Account feature), dental and vision options; employee and spouse/child life insurance; short and long-term disability protection; 401(k) with PNC match, pension and stock purchase plans; dependent care reimbursement account; back-up child/elder care; adoption, surrogacy, and doula reimbursement; educational assistance, including select programs fully paid; a robust wellness program with financial incentives.

In addition, PNC generally provides the following paid time off, depending on your eligibility: maternity and/or parental leave; up to 11 paid holidays each year; 8 occasional absence days each year, unless otherwise required by law; between 15 to 25 vacation days each year, depending on career level; and years of service.

To learn more about these and other programs, including benefits for full time and part-time employees, visit Your PNC Total Rewards .

Disability Accommodations Statement

If an accommodation is required to participate in the application process, please contact us via email at AccommodationRequest@pnc.com . Please include “accommodation request” in the subject line title and be sure to include your name, the job ID, and your preferred method of contact in the body of the email. Emails not related to accommodation requests will not receive responses. Applicants may also call 877-968-7762 and say "Workday" for accommodation assistance. All information provided will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.

At PNC we foster an inclusive and accessible workplace. We provide reasonable accommodations to employment applicants and qualified individuals with a disability who need an accommodation to perform the essential functions of their positions.

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO)

PNC provides equal employment opportunity to qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other categories protected by law.

This position is subject to the requirements of Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (FDIA) and, for any registered role, the Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing Act of 2008 (SAFE Act) and/or the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA), which prohibit the hiring of individuals with certain criminal history.

California Residents

Refer to the California Consumer Privacy Act Privacy Notice to gain understanding of how PNC may use or disclose your personal information in our hiring practices.
company_description: At PNC, you’ll do meaningful work that helps make a difference for our customers. You’ll have access to benefits and development opportunities that help you grow – both personally and professionally.

title: Senior Business Analyst - Medicaid
description:
Be part of a team that unleashes the power of leading-edge technologies to help improve the health and well-being of those most vulnerable in our country and communities. Working at Gainwell carries its rewards. You’ll have an incredible opportunity to grow your career in a company that values work flexibility, learning, and career development. You’ll add to your technical credentials and certifications while enjoying a generous, flexible vacation policy and educational assistance. We also have comprehensive leadership and technical development academies to help build your skills and capabilities.


Summary

As a Senior Business Analyst - Medicaid at Gainwell, you can contribute your skills as we harness the power of technology to help our clients improve the health and well-being of the members they serve — a community’s most vulnerable. Connect your passion with purpose, teaming with people who thrive on finding innovative solutions to some of healthcare’s biggest challenges. Here are the details on this position.

Your role in our mission

Play a critical part in ensuring Gainwell is meeting our clients’ objectives in important areas.

  • Help coordinate a business analyst team’s duties and activities on IT projects and nurture newer team members by providing guidance and support
  • Be a knowledgeable bridge between clients, project managers and technical staff to define, document and share business requirements and expected impact
  • Work with the client to develop business specs at the start of a technical project
  • Analyze, plan, design, document or make recommendations to improve business processes to support client’s technology goals
  • Help verify that all requirements have been met by approving and validating test results
  • Exercise your ability to use basic analytical or relational database software — such as Excel or SQL — to quantify the anticipated impact of work

What we're looking for

  • 6 or more years of experience in a relevant Business Analyst position with 3 or more years of Medicaid and Medicare experience preferred
  • In-depth knowledge of CMS regulations, HIPAA compliance, and state-specific Medicaid requirements
  • Knowledge of computer programming concepts such as configuration, development and batch processing
  • Advanced knowledge in analytical software such as Microsoft Excel or SQL and other requirement-mapping tools such as Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) tools
  • Strong client communication skills translating client needs to actionable objectives
  • Strong analytical and business process re-engineering skills
  • Strong executive presence and communication skills to deliver messages to business leaders, clients and technical personnel
  • A leader who motivates others to action and communicates key technical ideas in a digestible way

What you should expect in this role

    • Fully remote options from continental US locations only
    • Video cameras must be used during all interviews, as well as during the initial week of orientation
    • The deadline to submit applications for this posting is December 11, 2025

    #LI-HC1


The pay range for this position is $69,400.00 - $99,200.00 per year, however, the base pay offered may vary depending on geographic region, internal equity, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. Put your passion to work at Gainwell. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your career in a company that values work flexibility, learning, and career development. All salaried, full-time candidates are eligible for our generous, flexible vacation policy, a 401(k) employer match, comprehensive health benefits, and educational assistance. We also have a variety of leadership and technical development academies to help build your skills and capabilities.


We believe nothing is impossible when you bring together people who care deeply about making healthcare work better for everyone. Build your career with Gainwell, an industry leader. You’ll be joining a company where collaboration, innovation, and inclusion fuel our growth. Learn more about Gainwell at our company website and visit our Careers site for all available job role openings.


Gainwell Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer, where all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), age, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Senior Associate, Business Operations
description:
You could work anywhere. Why us?
  • Join a pre-IPO startup with capital, traction and runway ($240M funded | 60X revenue growth in 5 years | $2T market size)
  • Partner with our VP of BizOps & Analytics, Armando La Rocca (ex-BCG, Better)
  • Disrupt a massive market and take us to a $10B business in the next few years
  • Be immersed in a talent-dense environment and greatly accelerate your career growth

About the opportunity:

Jerry is looking for a Senior Associate, Business Operations to join our growing team! We hit a huge milestone in early 2024 by achieving profitability and have ambitious goals for the next few years — scale from 5M to 50M customers and become a $10B business. As a Senior Associate, Business Operations, you will play a key role in championing data-driven decisions across the company’s most critical business initiatives (including carrier growth and development, building new products from 0-1, etc.). As part of the business operations & analytics team, you will leverage advanced machine learning models to conduct in-depth analyses and extract insights that will shape our growth strategies.

Jerry is building the first super app to make car ownership affordable and accessible – insurance, buy/sell, registration, loans, safety, repairs, parking, etc – a $2T market in the U.S. We started with insurance in 2019, and since then we’ve launched loan refinancing, driving insights, repair marketplace, car diagnostics, and a GenAI-powered chatbot & voicebot. We have amassed over 5M customers, raised $240MM in funding, scaled our revenue 60X and our team to 225 across 6 countries.

Here's what an ex-McKinsey teammate has to say about joining Jerry:

"I’ve really enjoyed working at Jerry because it’s allowed me to flex the strategy muscles I built at McKinsey while also getting much closer to implementation. Unlike traditional consulting, I’m not just handing off a recommendation — I actually get to own the metrics, design A/B tests, and see how our strategies play out in the real world.

Jerry has a deeply data-driven culture. We A/B test everything, and there’s been a big investment in data infrastructure — from clean, well-structured data to a strong data engineering team that supports real decision-making. As a result, the data and BizOps team is seen as a core strategic partner within the company.

Another thing I’ve appreciated is the team itself. A lot of people here come from MBB, so I’ve still got the energy, sharp thinking, and high bar that I had at McKinsey — but now I also get to build, test, and iterate on the strategies I help develop. It’s a great mix of ownership, rigor, and impact."

How you will make an impact:

  • Partner with marketing, product, and business development teams to integrate customer performance insights into user and partner acquisition strategies
  • Lead the design, execution, and analysis of A/B experiments on new and existing features, extracting key insights to inform product and business strategies
  • Define, understand, and test levers to drive profitable and scalable user acquisition and partnership growth
  • Identify opportunities to automate manual processes and optimize operational efficiency

Preferred experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitatively or intellectually rigorous discipline
  • 2+ years of management consulting experience from a top firm (McKinsey, Bain, and Boston Consulting Group preferred) OR relevant experience in business analysis/operations
  • High level of comfort with SQL and/or running complex data analysis

Who you are:

  • You have a framework for problem solving and live by first principles
  • You are comfortable communicating with audiences varying from front-line employees to the company’s C-suite
  • You set a very high bar for yourself and for your team, and you are constantly pushing that bar higher in the pursuit of excellence

About Jerry.ai:

Jerry.ai is America’s first and only super app to radically simplify car ownership. We are redefining how people manage owning a car, one of their most expensive and time-consuming assets.

Backed by artificial intelligence and machine learning, Jerry.ai simplifies and automates owning and maintaining a car while providing personalized services for all car owners' needs. We spend every day innovating and improving our AI-powered app to provide the best possible experience for our customers. From car insurance and financing to maintenance and safety, Jerry.ai does it all.

title: Data Scientist
description:
You could be a data scientist anywhere. Why us?
  • Join a pre-IPO startup with capital, traction and runway ($240M funded | 60X revenue growth in 5 years | $2T market size)
  • Partner with our VP of Data Science & Analytics, Armando La Rocca (ex-BCG, Better)
  • Disrupt a massive market and take us to a $10B business in the next few years
  • Be immersed in a talent-dense environment and greatly accelerate your career growth

About the opportunity:

Jerry is looking for a Data scientist to join our growing team! We hit a huge milestone in early 2024 by achieving profitability and have ambitious goals for the next few years — scale from 5M to 50M customers and become a $10B business. As a data scientist, you will play a key role in championing data-driven decisions across the company’s most critical business initiatives (including carrier growth and development, building new products from 0-1, etc.). As part of the data science & analytics team, you will leverage advanced machine learning models to conduct in-depth analyses and extract insights that will shape our growth strategies.

Jerry is building the first super app to make car ownership affordable and accessible – insurance, buy/sell, registration, loans, safety, repairs, parking, etc – a $2T market in the U.S. We started with insurance in 2019, and since then we’ve launched loan refinancing, driving insights, repair marketplace, car diagnostics, and a GenAI-powered chatbot & voicebot. We have amassed over 5M customers, raised $240MM in funding, scaled our revenue 60X and our team to 225 across 6 countries.

Here's what an ex-BCG teammate has to say about joining Jerry:

"The biggest difference between my current role at Jerry and my past life at BCG is being able to feel the direct impact my work has on the business, every day. In consulting, I rarely felt like my work was having any impact on the world, despite advising the largest global corporations. Here, I can see that my work is moving the needle on key company metrics in a matter of weeks. When I say "key," I mean it: I am not talking about secondary KPIs that no one pays attention to, but business-critical metrics that the CEO and the rest of the C-suite look at on a daily basis (think sales, retention, pricing, etc).

The benefit of being a digital-first company is that we are sitting on a treasure trove of data. This means we almost never have to make a decision that's not backed by a robust, statistically significant analysis. While data science can be a support function in some other places (this was something I wanted to avoid), data scientists at Jerry are at the core of the business.

I have also appreciated the professional growth opportunities. I have had flexibility to work on the skills I wanted to develop, be it technical or soft skills. I have found continuous learning to be one of my most important drivers of happiness at work. Getting the space and latitude to work on projects that I am most interested in was all the more important for this reason."

How you will make an impact:

  • Partner with marketing, product, and business development teams to integrate customer performance insights into user and partner acquisition strategies
  • Lead the design, execution, and analysis of A/B experiments on new and existing features, extracting key insights to inform product and business strategies
  • Define, understand, and test levers to drive profitable and scalable user acquisition and partnership growth
  • Identify opportunities to automate manual processes and optimize operational efficiency

Preferred experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitatively or intellectually rigorous discipline
  • 1+ years of experience from a top-tier economic consulting firm (Analysis Group, Cornerstone Research, Charles River Associates preferred) OR 1+ years of management consulting experience from a top firm (McKinsey, Bain, and Boston Consulting Group preferred) OR relevant experience in data science/business analysis
  • High level of comfort with SQL or Python

Who you are:

  • You have a framework for problem solving and live by first principles
  • You are comfortable communicating with audiences varying from front-line employees to the company’s C-suite
  • You set a very high bar for yourself and for your team, and you are constantly pushing that bar higher in the pursuit of excellence

While we appreciate your interest and application, only applicants under consideration will be contacted.

title: Reporting Analyst, Operations Strategy
description:
Support Center - Irving

The Reporting Analyst, Operations Strategy will own the design, development, and delivery of data reporting and performance dashboards that provide actionable insights into store operations, omni-channel performance, and customer experience. This role plays a critical part in enabling data-driven decision-making across Operations, ensuring leadership has clear visibility into KPIs, trends, and opportunities to drive growth and operational excellence.

A successful candidate will work closely with the Data Analyst to comfortably translate large amounts of raw data into digestible insights for operations leadership. Additionally, this individual will be able to anticipate the data needs of operations leadership in order to assist in successfully storytelling and/or control narratives.

Major Activities

  • Develop and maintain enterprise reporting and dashboards for store performance, labor productivity, omni-channel adoption (Buy Online Pick Up in Store, Curbside, Ship From Store), and strategic initiatives.
  • Build and automate reporting pipelines that integrate data from POS, ecommerce, supply chain, labor, and financial systems.
  • Partner with Data Analyst to embed predictive models and advanced analytics into reports for forward-looking insights.
  • Establish data governance standards, ensuring consistency, accuracy, and reliability across all Operations reporting.
  • Lead the weekly, monthly, and quarterly business performance reviews, prepare reporting packages for executive meetings.
  • Support competitive intelligence and market benchmarking through external reporting and trend analyses.
  • Translate complex datasets into executive-ready visualizations, presentations, and dashboards to inform decision-making at the highest levels.

Other duties as assigned

Preferred Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Information Systems, Finance, Economics, or related field.

Minimum Type of Experience Required

  • 3–5+ years of experience in reporting, business intelligence, or analytics, preferably in retail or omni-channel operations.
  • Expert proficiency in BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and strong command of SQL.
  • Advanced Excel skills; exposure to Python or R is a plus.
  • Demonstrated experience working with large, complex retail datasets (POS, ecommerce, fulfillment, financial).
  • Experience distilling data into executive-level strategic storytelling.

Other

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to connect data to business performance. Anticipates data and reporting needs/opportunities for Operations Leadership. Able to quickly and effectively pull data and translate for executive leadership.
  • Excellent data visualization and storytelling capabilities.
  • High attention to detail and accuracy under tight deadlines.
  • Collaborative mindset with the ability to work cross-functionally.
  • Strong communication skills; comfortable presenting insights to senior leadership.

Applicants in the U.S. must satisfy federal, state, and local legal requirements of the job.

At The Michaels Companies Inc., our purpose is to fuel the joy of creativity and celebration. As the leading destination for creating and celebrating in North America, we operate over 1,300 stores in 49 states and Canada and online at Michaels.com and Michaels.ca. The Michaels Companies, Inc. also owns Artistree, a manufacturer of custom and specialty framing merchandise. Founded in 1973 and headquartered in Irving, Texas, Michaels is the best place for all things creative. For more information, please visit www.michaels.com.

At Michaels, we prioritize the wellbeing of our teams by providing robust benefits for both full-time and part-time Team Members. Our benefits include health insurance (medical, dental, and vision), paid time off, tuition assistance, generous employee discounts, and much more. For more information, visit www.michaels.com.

Michaels is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are here for all Team Members and all customers to create, innovate and be better together.

Michaels is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with this commitment, Michaels will assure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. title: Data Analyst, Operations Strategy
description:
Support Center - Irving

The Data Analyst, Operations Strategy will apply advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and data mining to help drive retail and omni-channel performance. This role will uncover actionable insights into customer behavior, store performance, and operational efficiency, supporting strategic initiatives such as store of the future, labor optimization, portfolio planning, and omni-channel integration. A successful candidate will be able to comfortably translate large amounts of raw data into digestible insights for operations leadership. Additionally, this individual will be able to anticipate the data needs of leadership in order to assist in successfully storytelling and/or control narratives.

Major Activities

  • Develop and deploy predictive models to forecast customer demand, labor productivity, and omni-channel adoption (Buy Online Pick-up In Store, Curbside, Ship From Store).
  • Conduct data mining across retail, customer, and financial datasets to identify patterns, opportunities, and risks.
  • Support competitive intelligence analysis by modeling external market and competitor data.
  • Partner with Reporting Analyst to integrate models into dashboards and KPIs.
  • Provide ad hoc analytics for senior leadership, including scenario planning and sensitivity analyses.
  • Ensure data governance, accuracy, and consistency in all Operations datasets.
  • Translate technical findings into clear, actionable business recommendations for executives.

Other duties as assigned

Preferred Education

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.

Minimum Type of Experience Required

  • 3–5+ years of experience in applied analytics, preferably in retail, e-commerce, or consumer industries.
  • Proficiency with SQL, Python, R, or other modeling languages.
  • Expert in Microsoft Suite products, especially Excel.
  • Hands-on experience with predictive modeling, clustering, regression, and machine learning techniques.
  • Familiarity with retail data sources (POS, customer transactions, omni-channel fulfillment, real estate/store data).
  • Expert in Power BI (data modeling, DAX, measures, visuals).
  • Proven ability to turn analytics into compelling executive-ready presentations.

Other

  • Strong problem-solving and hypothesis-driven approach.
  • Ability to communicate complex analytics to non-technical audiences.
  • Collaborative, with ability to partner across operations, finance, and merchandising.
  • Intellectually curious. Willing/unafraid to ask questions.
  • Expert in pulling data quickly and effectively. Anticipates leadership’s daily, weekly, and quarterly data needs through solid understanding of the business and operations.

Applicants in the U.S. must satisfy federal, state, and local legal requirements of the job.

title: Power BI Developer I
description:
IBC Bank successes are the result of an aggressive and innovative attitude. The Bank's "We Do More" philosophy reflects its dedication to the growth and success of its employees, customers and communities. IBC bank hires talented, creative and dedicated individuals to help our business succeed. We are a company that values leadership, community engagement and relationship building that leads to a culture of excellence. We are currently seeking to fill positions across all business segments. IBC's focus is to be customer centric and strive to provide excellent customer experience.
Time Type:
Full time
This is an in-office position.
Department:
650 Management Services
Job Summary:
The Business Intelligence Developer is responsible for creating and managing BI and analytical solutions that turn data into knowledge. In this role, this person should have a background in data and business analysis and have the keen ability to translate business needs to technical specifications. This position is responsible for development of visual reports, dashboards and KPI scorecards with secondary duties involving creating data sources using TSQL queries, report creation, and maintenance using SSRS. The Business Intelligence Developer will serve as a liaison between business lines and IT to collaborate with these teams to integrate systems as needed.
Job Description:
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
The statements on this job description are intended to describe the general nature of level of work being performed by incumbents. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required by all incumbents.
  • Develop and manage effective working relationships with other departments, groups and personnel with whom work must be coordinated or interfaced
  • Gather and document functional and technical requirements, and translate requirements into reporting solutions, analytic tools and dashboards
  • Develop visual reports, dashboards, and KPI scorecards using Power BI desktop based on business requirements; publish and support all dashboards across the company
  • Develop in-depth understanding of underlying data, data structures, and business uses to ensure reports meet client need
  • Expertise in using advanced level calculations on data sets
  • Develop and update technical documentation of report logic and processes
  • Coordinate quality control and peer review processes to ensure integrity of the data available to users
  • Provide support as required to ensure the availability and optimized performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users
  • Meet professional obligations through efficient work habits such as, meeting deadlines, honoring schedules, coordinating resources and meetings in an effective and timely manner, and demonstrate respect for others
  • Other duties as assigned
CORE COMPETENCIES
Displays acceptable Leadership core competencies, and is committed to continued development of strengths and gaps, in the following categories:
  • Individual Work Characteristics
  • Decision-Making
  • Planning and Organizing
  • Leadership Styles
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Communication skills
SKILLS
  • TSQL programming proficiency
  • Proficient in making DAX queries in Power BI desktop
  • Knowledge of data visualization and visual perception
  • Strong interpersonal and customer service skills
  • Analytical mind with a problem solving attitude
  • Excellent communicator – both verbal and written
  • Ability to work with/for multiple employees and meet deadlines
  • Facilitation and coordination of teams
  • Strong conceptual, analytical, and judgement abilities
  • Experience with HR and/or Finance data is a plus
EDUCATION
  • BS in Computer Science or Information Systems preferred – will consider 5-7 year of commensurate experience
  • Experience working with predictive analytics, forecasting models, and statistical software
  • Experience in data preparation and data warehousing projects
  • Experience and Familiarity with BI technologies, specifically Microsoft Power BI
  • Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)

title: Senior Business Analyst (Healthcare)
description:
We are looking for a motivated and driven Senior Business Analyst to provide strategic business analysis and IT consulting services. At this position you be able to participate in development of high-quality solutions that enable Healthcare industry to meet the changing needs of the global landscape.


The focus of this position is to work closely with the business stakeholders to gain an in-depth understanding of the customer's business strategy, processes, services, roadmap, and the context in which the business operates. This role will be key to understanding the documenting capabilities needed to address business challenges.

Our projects are related to designing and implementing solutions for key players in the healthcare industry in North America, Europe and the Middle East. The solutions are related to healthcare information management, software-as-medical-devices, healthcare information portals and mobile apps as well as platforms for medical research and clinical trials.

Main responsibilities:

Alongside other key stakeholders such as Sales/Account Managers, Project Managers, and Solution Architects, you will:

  • Lead complex Healthcare projects during all stages: presales, initiation, planning, execution, submission package preparation, go-live
  • Work closely with business stakeholders, facilitate daily meetings and presentations to identify requirements, share ideas and findings
  • Perform requirements analysis to determine the best solutions, and influence business decisions
  • Document and communicate the results of your efforts
  • Identify and dig into any issue during project execution providing general guidance and necessary leadership to mitigate related risks
  • Proactively and reactively identify improvement opportunities, especially related to standardization of processes and working best practices
  • Ready to develop in this domain and participate in all kinds of conferences/exhibitions and webinars

Required experience and knowledge:

  • 5+ years of professional experience in IT Business Analyst position
  • Relevant experience in the healthcare sector (provider, payer, drug development, pharmaceutical, etc.)
  • Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills
  • Experience working in a pre-sale environment from solutioning to client communication
  • Knowledge of software development/Product lifecycle, methodologies (Agile, Kanban, Waterfall), and IT roles
  • Knowledge and experience in information privacy laws, including but not limited to HIPAA
  • Ability to establish effective, accurate, appropriate, and timely communication within teams
  • Attention to detail and time management skills
  • Fluent English

Qualification and Education:

  • Baccalaureate degree in health information management or a related healthcare field, or 4+ years of experience in the area. (nice to have)
  • Experience with HL7, FHIR, CDA standards and EHR/HIE software (nice to have)
  • Knowledge and experience in information privacy laws, including but not limited to HIPAA.
  • Familiarity with US/EU/GULF health care relevant legislation and standards for the protection of health information and patient privacy.
  • Demonstrated skills in collaboration, teamwork, and problem-solving to achieve goals.
  • Demonstrated skills in providing excellent service to customers.
  • Attention to detail necessary.

Requirements:

  • Experience in designing, building, and implementing business solutions using IT, or will to do so.
  • Experience in requirements definition using a wild range of BA techniques and tools, deployment of business requirements to information systems, risk management, or will to do so.
  • Ability to follow rigorous system development life cycle, to use quality and project management best practices, and to ensure compliance with processes related to regulatory or compliance requirements, including change control and problem management procedures.
  • Strong organization, facilitation, written and oral communication, presentation skills, and persistent in the face of obstacles or challenges.
  • Ability to maintain sufficient business and technical expertise to be comfortable communicating business and technical requirements with a wide audience.
  • Ability to educate business users and management on new business processes and procedures.
  • Upper-intermediate or higher level of spoken and written English (B2+).

We guarantee

  • High salary.
  • Professional training and obtaining certificates at the company's expense.
  • Paid vacation.
  • Medical insurance and 100% payment for sick leave.
  • Corporate classes in English, German, and Polish languages.
  • A variety of corporate events.
  • The possibility of remote work from any location

title: Operations Manager
description:
The Operations Manager acts as a coordination and analytical function within the Sales/Account Department, ensuring data transparency, operational consistency, and process excellence. The role supports the VP of Sales and Sales Directors by enabling a data-driven approach to decision-making, maintaining alignment between Sales, Account Management, and Production teams, and overseeing the integrity of sales-related systems and reporting.

Your responsibilities

  • Data management and analytics enablement
    • Collect, validate, and structure operational data from CRM, Power BI, and other corporate systems to support performance analysis and decision-making.
    • Consolidate metrics across business lines to provide a unified sales performance view (pipeline dynamics, win/loss ratios, conversion, RFP analytics, etc.).
    • Support Sales and AM teams in adopting data-driven practices through regular insights and dashboards.
  • System ownership and coordination
    • Act as business owner for CRM and Power BI systems on behalf of the Sales function.
    • Translate SM and AM team requirements into system change requests, review implementations, validate outcomes, and collect feedback from end users.
    • Serve as the operational bridge between Sales and IT/data teams, offloading this function from SMs
  • Documentation and compliance control
    • Oversee the presence and correctness of signed documents in the system
    • Ensure timely update and completeness of contractual and procedural documentation for sales opportunities.
  • Reporting and executive preparation
    • Prepare data and materials for weekly VIP and resource opportunity reviews
    • Aggregate data from multiple systems to create concise management summaries.
  • Lead flow initial analytics preparation
    • Perform manual data validation and cleansing of incoming lead streams on a weekly basis
    • Prepare datasets for advanced analytics (conversion, source quality, performance benchmarking)
  • RFP performance analysis
    • Collect and systematize data on problematic RFPs to enable deep-dive analysis and process optimization.
    • Analyze KPI adherence across teams (Sales, Presales, Production) and highlight bottlenecks in proposal processing.
    • Identify and clean up data on RFP-related difficulties for further statistical and qualitative analysis – will be used in regular reviews as a space for improvements.
  • Competitiveness and market insight
    • Conduct analysis of proposal competitiveness, including ad-hoc competitor intelligence to understand strengths and weaknesses.
    • Track and summarize industry trends and competitor activities; provide pre-screened insights for discussion with management and practice leaders.
  • Policy management and alignment
    • Maintain and regularly update Sales and Account Management policies to ensure they reflect current practices.
    • Create new policies upon request from the Sales or AM teams.
    • Identify alignment gaps between Sales/AM policies and Production procedures, ensuring consistency and governance across functions.
  • Campaign and data preparation support
    • Collect and prepare client and lead datasets for outbound campaigns, events, and targeted communication activities.
    • Compile and maintain distribution lists for SMs and AMs
    • Coordinate and follow up with colleagues to ensure timely execution of outreach and marketing-related tasks (“pinging” for control and status updates).
    • Track and consolidate statistics on campaign performance, response rates, and task completion to provide visibility to management.

KPI's

  • Accuracy and timeliness of data and reports.
  • Reduction of manual data handling and duplicated efforts.
  • Improved CRM/BI usability and satisfaction across Sales and AM teams.
  • Increased transparency of RFP performance and process bottlenecks.
  • Alignment and compliance of SM/AM policies with production workflows.

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of experience in sales operations, business analysis, or project coordination roles (preferably in IT services).
  • Strong analytical mindset with practical experience in CRM systems and Power BI.
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail; ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Upper-intermediate or higher level of English.
  • Experience in preparing management reports, validating operational data, and supporting process improvement initiatives.

We guarantee

  • High salary.
  • Professional training and obtaining certificates at the company's expense.
  • Paid vacation.
  • Medical insurance and 100% payment for sick leave.
  • Corporate classes in English, German, and Polish languages.
  • A variety of corporate events.
  • The possibility of remote work from any location.

title: Healthcare Business Analyst with BDD & Gherkins-3
description:
Job Type: Full Time

Job Category: IT

Job Description

Job Title: Healthcare Business Analyst with BDD & Gherkins
Location: Remote
Fulltime

Must Haves : BDD (Behavioural Driven Development) , BDD based acceptance criteria using Gherkin format.

JOB ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Actively solicit, analyze and negotiate customer requirements in order to ensure that the project team can develop solutions that meet the customer's real needs; minimize requirement defects up front, establish and maintain agreement between the customer and project team on requirements for the project deliverables.
  • Manage multiple priorities, customer expectations and relationships with all stakeholders. Manage relationships with customers, project managers, and any/all levels of management.
  • Meet and work with project business sponsors, software end-users, applications development staff, and others as necessary to perform assignments. Conduct meetings with business stakeholders to actively solicit, analyze and negotiate customer requirements. Obtain signoff on business requirements.
  • Solicit input from developers and other technical staff to determine the level of effort required to complete tasks and from business community to define scope.
  • Assist with project planning, including methods, processes, tasks, schedules.
  • Work with applications development staff during the technical design, programming and unit-testing and implementation stages. Conduct walkthroughs as handoff from analysis to development in life cycle.
  • Coordinate changes to functional specifications that occur during development and update functional specifications as required.
  • Support customers in training efforts for end users and staff members.
  • Mentor junior staff members.
  • Collaborate, coordinate, and communicate across disciplines and departments.
  • Ensure compliance with HIPAA regulations and requirements.
  • Demonstrate commitment to the Company's core values.
  • The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way construed as all encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary.
  • Please note due to the exposure of PHI sensitive data, this role is a High-Risk Role.


JOB SCOPE: Incumbent works under minimal direction and uses independent judgment to identify issues, trends & problems and recommend action plans and evaluate results on projects that may not be clearly defined and are large in scope. Work is varied and complex, requiring the individual to use a broad range of knowledge gained through extensive experience. The position works with internal and external sources to complete objectives, keeping the needs of external and internal customers as a priority when making decisions and taking actions.

REQUIREMENTS (Education, Experience, and Training):

  • Minimum bachelor’s degree, or 4 years of related experience. Graduate degree a plus.
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as a Business Analyst
  • Experience in a Project Management Organization preferred
  • Experience designing and implementing project management methodologies and requirements definition and management practices
  • Knowledge of broad range project methodologies and best practices for requirements definition and management including Waterfall, Iterative, and Agile
  • Expert-level business analysis, system analysis and project management skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Analytic, organization, interpersonal, prioritization, multi-tasking, initiating, communication, planning and technical skills
  • Ability to lead, develop, mentor and coach team
  • Ability to use software and peripherals related to performance of job responsibilities
  • Ability to facilitate teams and client relationships to satisfy needs and identify improvements
  • Ability to develop strong relationships with all levels of management
  • Ability to demonstrate commitment to excellent customer service and follow through
  • Ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects including continuous evaluation and re-ordering of priorities for self and staff as business needs dictate
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from internal and external customers
  • Ability to be flexible and creative in problem solving and identifying process improvements
  • Ability to anticipate business needs and think with a business owner mind-set

BUSINESS CONTINUITY ANALYST

title: Manager, SAP Solutions
description:
Summary

Summary/Objective

JERA Americas is seeking a dynamic and experienced Manager, SAP Solutions to lead the strategic and operational management of SAP solutions across the organization. This role will serve as the primary liaison between business units and technical teams, ensuring seamless integration, enhancement, and support of SAP systems including S/4 HANA, SAP Concur, SAP SuccessFactors, and SAP Ariba.

The Manager will oversee external vendors and collaborate with global teams, including counterparts at JERA headquarters in Tokyo, to deliver high-quality SAP services. This role is critical to driving business value through SAP technologies and ensuring alignment with organizational goals.

Position Description

Essential Functions


  • Serve as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for all SAP solutions within JERA Americas, including S/4 HANA, SAP Concur, SAP SuccessFactors, and SAP Ariba.
  • Lead and manage SAP-related initiatives across the organization, ensuring alignment with business goals and IT strategy.
  • Act as the primary liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, translating business requirements into actionable technical solutions.
  • Provide strategic oversight and operational management of external vendor teams responsible for Run & Maintain and Enhancement services.
  • Collaborate with global SAP teams, including counterparts at JERA headquarters in Tokyo, to ensure seamless integration and support.
  • Oversee system configuration, upgrades, and enhancements across SAP platforms.
  • Ensure SAP solutions are continuously optimized to meet evolving business needs.
  • Develop and maintain documentation, training materials, and support resources for SAP users.
  • Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and ensure timely resolution.
  • Lead user acceptance testing, change management, and training initiatives.
  • Maintain strong relationships with SAP vendors and participate in user group meetings.

Position Description Continued

Competencies


  • Deep understanding of SAP S/4 HANA (FICO, Treasury, Procurement).
  • Solid understanding of SAP architecture, ABAP Development, and HANA DB.
  • Hands-on knowledge of BAPI, iDoc, Web Services, and SAP integration methods.
  • Expertise in SAP Solution Manager including ChaRM configuration, workflow design, and transport management.
  • Strong understanding of SAP ALM best practices.
  • Familiarity with SAP Concur, SuccessFactors, and Ariba.
  • Knowledge of SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) is a plus.
  • Strong business analysis and project management skills.
  • Ability to bridge functional and technical domains.
  • Experience managing external vendors and global teams.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ethical conduct and professionalism.
  • Process development and optimization.

Qualifications

Required Education and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Engineering, Business, Finance, or related field.
  • Minimum 8 years of experience in SAP environments.
  • 8+ years of experience with S/4 HANA and other SAP platforms (Concur, SuccessFactors, Ariba).
  • Proven experience managing SAP projects and vendor relationships.
  • Strong understanding of SAP integration and business processes.
  • Exposure to technology infrastructure as it applies to the delivery of functional solutions.
  • Experience working with diverse teams across global locations.
  • Strong background in application Release Management, Change Management, and Incident Management


JERA Americas does not accept unsolicited resumes from third party recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of an executed Recruitment Services Agreement, JERA Americas shall have no obligation to pay any referral compensation or recruiter fee.

title: Senior Sales Operations Business Analyst
description:
About Us: At LOGIX Fiber Networks, we are committed to driving growth through innovation, collaboration, and excellence. As a leading player in the Telecommunications industry, we are dedicated to delivering outstanding products and services to our customers. We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Sales Operations Business Analyst to join our Sales Operations team and contribute to our success by providing critical insights and analysis that support our sales and marketing strategies.

Position Overview: The Senior Business Analyst will play a key role in supporting our sales, marketing, and business planning efforts by leveraging data and analytics to drive strategic decision-making. This role requires a strong analytical mindset, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including Product, Engineering, Operations, Customer Service, IT, and Finance. This role will focus on designing and implementing a sales data management strategy, identifying opportunities to improve processes through analytics, and championing a market-driven outlook to maximize performance and revenue.

Key Responsibilities:

Sales and Market Data Gathering, Analytics & Modeling

  • Collect, clean, and organize data from various sources to ensure comprehensive and accurate analysis.
  • Develop advanced analytical models to support sales forecasts, market segmentation, accurate lead generation, and customer profiling.
  • Fluent in data fundamentals and data manipulation using procedural languages, statistics, experimentation, and modeling.

Sales Data Management Strategy

  • Ensure data integrity and consistency across sales reports and analytics, facilitating accurate and timely decision-making.
  • Partner with Sales and Reporting teams to design and implement a sales data management strategy to create seamless reporting for sales insights and decision-making.

Sales Operational Analysis & Reporting

  • Produce accurate, clear, and concise operational analysis to communicate key trends, variances, risks, and opportunities.
  • Independent ability to extract and consolidate sales, retention/churn, and marketing data from multiple sources and prepare insightful reporting and analytics.
  • Evolve and maintain dashboards, reports, and performance metrics to track and report on sales and marketing effectiveness.
  • Evolve and maintain monthly sales performance metrics that track individual, team and company sales results to budget.
  • Prepare and deliver presentations to senior management and other stakeholders, effectively communicating findings and recommendations.

Performance Monitoring & Sales Improvement

  • Monitor various sales and marketing initiatives and performance on a regular basis to maximize performance and revenue.
  • Identify and execute actionable sales improvement initiatives based on performance data and market insights.
  • Collect, trend, and analyze data to assist in sales compensation and commissions strategy

Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Work closely with all departments analyze product performance, customer feedback, and market trends to inform product development and positioning.
  • Collaborate with Finance to ensure alignment between sales forecasts, budget planning, and financial performance.
  • Partner with Customer Service to assess customer satisfaction, identify recurring issues, and develop strategies to improve the customer experience.

Stakeholder Communication

  • Act as a liaison between sales, marketing, and other departments to ensure alignment and support for key initiatives.
  • Communicate complex information clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Ability to distill and present actionable information from complex research or analysis.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Marketing, Data Science, Statistics or a related field. Master’s degree or relevant certification (e.g., CFA, CBAP) is a plus.
  • 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, with a focus on sales and marketing analytics.
  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, BI tools such as Tableau or Power BI).
  • Proven experience in data gathering, advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and data warehouse design.
  • Demonstrated ability to produce clear and actionable operational analysis and reports.
  • Proven experience in developing and implementing strategic planning models, especially related to network expansion and market segmentation.
  • Experience in identifying opportunities to improve processes and drive efficiency through analytics.
  • Excellent analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  • Proven experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams and managing multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and effectively.
  • Extensive Excel and PowerPoint knowledge or a strong desire to achieve expert-level skills.
  • Independent ability to extract and consolidate sales and marketing data from multiple sources and prepare insightful reporting and analytics.
  • Ability to distill and present actionable information from complex research or analysis.
  • Detail-oriented with a proactive approach to problem-solving and process improvement.

Physical Requirements:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate by typing, reading, talking, and listening effectively. The employee will be required to work for extended periods of time at a desk on a computer and must be able to maneuver through office spaces as needed. Accommodation will be provided as necessary to ensure all employees can fulfill their job responsibilities effectively.

Why Join Us?

  • Impact: Make a significant contribution to the growth and success of our company.
  • Innovation: Work with cutting-edge tools and technologies in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
  • Collaboration: Be part of a collaborative and supportive team that values your expertise and input.
  • Growth: Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Flexible spending account
  • Health insurance
  • Health savings account
  • Life insurance
  • Military leave
  • On-site gym
  • Paid parental leave
  • Paid time off
  • Parental leave
  • Referral program
  • Vision insurance

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

  • Business analysis: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Plano, TX 75093
